    • Method Detail

      • getExploredSize

        public int getExploredSize()
        Get the "size" of the explored terrain, which is a count of the number of tiles that have been explored by any rover.
        Returns:
        The total number of explored tiles.

      • getTotalSize

        public int getTotalSize()
        Get the number of tiles on the map.
        Returns:
        The number of tiles on the map.

      • getHeight

        public int getHeight()
        Get the height of the board. Any position with a valid x-coordinate and a y-coordinate in [0, ..., getHeight() - 1] is valid.
        Returns:
        the height of the board.

      • getWidth

        public int getWidth()
        Get the height of the board. Any position with an x-coordinate in the range [0, ..., getWidth() - 1] and a valid y-coordinate is valid.
        Returns:
        the width of the board.

      • isValid

        public boolean isValid(Position position)
        Report whether a given Position is within the field of play. Clear, impassable, and unexplored positions are all valid; a position is only invalid if it lies outside the boundaries of the board.
        Parameters:
        position - The position whose validity to check.
        Returns:
        Whether or not that position is within the boundaries of the board.

      • allPositions

        public java.lang.Iterable<Position> allPositions()
        Get an iterator over all positions in the board, including clear, impassable, and unexplored positions. The user should use this iterator in a READ ONLY FASHION.
        Returns:
        An iterator over all valid positions.

      • knownPositions

        public java.lang.Iterable<Position> knownPositions()
        Get an iterator over all of the positions that have been explored by any rover.
        Returns:
        An iterator that will provide all of the positions that have been explored by any rover.

      • getTerrainType

        public SmartPercepts.TerrainType getTerrainType(Position position)
        Get the TerrainType of a position. That might be TerrainType.CLEAR, TerrainType.IMPASSABLE, or TerrainType.UNEXPLORED for valid positions. If "position" has not yet been discovered by any rover (no rover has ever occupied nor attempted to occupy that place), this will return TerrainType.UNKNOWN. If the position has been explored (a rover has been there, or tried to go there but was bumped), TerrainType.CLEAR or TerrainType.IMPASSABLE will be returned, as appropriate.
        Parameters:
        position - The position about which the user wants to know.
        Returns:
        An instance of TerrainType, or null for invalid positions.
